casebody.data:
EMELIO SANCHEZ Y DOLTZ, Plaintiff and Respondent v. THE AMERICAN SUBMARINE COMPANY, Defendant and Appellant.

Before Speir and Sanford, JJ.

Decided, March 20, 1876. L Broker’s commission on sale of a vessel. The appeal was from a judgment entered on a verdict for the plaintiff. The only question involved was one of fact, viz., whether the plaintiff procured the sale, or another broker to whom defendant paid a commission. Speir, J.,

wrote for affirmance, holding that the question of fact was decided by the jury in accordance with the weight of the testimony.

Sanford, J., concurred.

Judgment affirmed with costs.
